channel.title: writePlayers();
channel.description:
Ok, my server at first did not have at the top saying the amount of total players online, the name of the server, etc.
so i made the public void under the implement.
and i put this writePlayers();
under the boolean process.
now i get the problem that it blinks repeatedly, and its really annoying, i tried to add it to the boolean like so: [code] public boolean process() { writePlayers(); // is being called regularily every 500ms [/code]
but it didn't work, anyone can help me please?

item.title: writePlayers();
item.dc:creator: @icauseownage icauseownage
item.description:
@icauseownage wrote:

i’ve tried many different methods.

tried these:

public boolean process() { writePlayers(); // is being called regularily every 500ms

public boolean process() { // is being called regularily every 500ms writePlayers();

public boolean process() { // is being called regularily every 500ms writePlayers(); writePlayers(); writePlayers(); writePlayers();

the last one just made it blink faster =/. do i add ints above the PBP? and yes i have the void public void writePlayers()

Read full topic

item.title: writePlayers();
item.dc:creator: @GoldenShard GoldenShard
item.description:
@GoldenShard wrote:

[quote=“icauseownage, post:1, topic:86656”]Ok, my server at first did not have at the top saying the amount of total players online, the name of the server, etc.

so i made the public void under the implement.

and i put this
writePlayers();

under the boolean process.

now i get the problem that it blinks repeatedly, and its really annoying, i tried to add it to the boolean like so:

public boolean process() { writePlayers(); // is being called regularily every 500ms

but it didn’t work, anyone can help me please?[/quote]

Make sure you have the void writePlayers() { then add this under PBP…

public boolean process() {//Is being called reg. 500 ms writePlayers();

Like so.

Read full topic

item.title: writePlayers();
item.dc:creator: @icauseownage icauseownage
item.description:
@icauseownage wrote:

no duh. i can read english i know what it says, but you HAVE to add it there, if you don’t that void won’t be called thus not appearing on the screen, unless you have another way of doing it?
